channel.title: The Modrich Travel Blog - Articles
channel.description: Stories and experiences from our occasional travels

item.title: Privacy Update
item.description: The right to privacy is a serious matter, and something that I take very seriously.

item.title: A new look and a new home
item.description: We have finished renovating our old home here at Wordpress.com, and have now moved back in. The old place at SquareSpace is still lingering, but will soon disappear for good.

item.title: Working in Durban (RSA)
item.description: So I have been in Durban for a few days now. Mostly work meetings with clients and not much down time to get out and see the place (im not hear for leisure!).

item.title: Headed to South Africa (for Work)
item.description: Tonight I boarded a flight from Melbourne destined for Durban, South Africa - via Perth (on Virgin Australia) and Johannesburg (on South African Airlines).

item.title: The City of Angels
item.description: Earlier in the week (Monday 17th Aug) we left New York behind us (sad to leave but we have to move on), and flew across the country to Los Angeles.

item.title: New York, New York
item.description: Updated 24-Aug-2015: As promised, more pictures have now been added to this post.

item.title: London Gin Club in Soho
item.description: Last night was our final night in London. Laura and I left Archie with Mum and Jo and then headed out to Soho to find the London Gin Club - something Laura had kindly tracked down for me and thought it would be a great way to spend our last night in London.

item.title: London and Bath
item.description: So we arrived into London on Thursday afternoon (6th August) from Paris after catching the EuroStar train across the channel.

item.title: Exploring more of Paris
item.description: Today has been much hotter than yesterday - about 34c - and after the big day we had yesterday we decided to take it a little easier and just hit a few of the sights - with the Eiffel Tower the first on the list.

item.title: A big day in Paris
item.description: Today has been a very BIG day or us in and around Paris - and we are all knackered.

item.title: On to Paris
item.description: This morning we were up early - but not as early as previous travel days - 6:30am is manageable.

item.title: In and around Aix-en-Provence
item.description: It’s been good to be back in one place for a few days. It’s still warm, but a lot cooler than where we have been in Italy - which makes getting out during the day a lot more manageable - especially for Archie our 18-month-old.

item.title: Rome to Aix-en-Provence via Genoa (by train)
item.description: Back in Rome

item.title: Alberobello
item.description: Saturday we packed up and checked out of the villa. It was sad to leave as its been an absolutely great time and very relaxing, but everything must come to an end and we must move on to our next destination - Alberobello.

item.title: San Gimignano
item.description: On Friday (24th July) we set out early and took a road trip to San Gimignano - about an hour or so away from where we were staying at the villa.

item.title: Vino e Pizza
item.description: So… We have been without Internet access for a few days, and the blog posts have been limited as a result of this. I have a lot to catch up on and as Internet access becomes available - and I have time - new blog posts will begin to show up.

item.title: A day trip to Assisi
item.description: Today we jumped in the cars and ventured out to Assisi for a day trip - roughly 120km from where we are staying.

item.title: A Tuscan Feast
item.description: We arranged with Franco, the owner of the villa, to prepare us a traditional Tuscan feast (an option available to anyone staying at the villa) on Tuesday evening.

item.title: An evening in Siena
item.description: Today we decided to venture out to nearby Siena for the evening - its too hot (38-40c) to be out and about with the kids during the heat of the day, and for us the time is much better spent cooling off and relaxing by the pool.

item.title: Villa Podere Incrociati
item.description: So after a long few days of travel, we arrived yesterday evening at what will become our home for the next week - villa Podere Incronciati - a traditional Tuscan villa built in 1840 about 20km outside of Siena.

item.title: The Family Vacation - Let's Begin
item.description: So… The last few day have been hectic and somewhat full-on to say the least.

item.title: Only days away
item.description: After almost 18 months of planning, we are now quickly approaching our departure date. Our bags are packed (well mostly), and we are ready to go.

item.title: The Modrich Travel Blog Relaunch
item.description: Welcome to the new Modrich Travel Blog site.

item.title: On the move again...
item.description: Its been a little while since our last blog post… but good news! We will soon be on the move again - and that means lots of new content over the next month and a half…

item.title: (Almost) Fathers Day
item.description: So to day was Fathers Day.

item.title: Just wandering around
item.description: Today’s plans evolved organically with more of a “why not” attitude rather than specific planning.

item.title: Chill out in Kingscliff ("The Babymoon")
item.description: It’s a cold, wet and windy Melbourne morning… 3am, and the alarm goes off.

item.title: Homeward bound
item.description: This morning I find myself at Raleigh Airport (RDU) waiting to board a plane - a few days ahead of my original return schedule.

item.title: The Flying Saucer
item.description: So it’s a Sunday afternoon in Raleigh, North Carolina. I find myself downtown with not much to do - as most places are closed.

item.title: Only in America #2
item.description: So it appears they are coming thick and fast…

item.title: Only in America #1
item.description: To kick off my “Only in America” series of posts (I am assuming there will be more than one), I bring to you some pictures of a locally “pimped ride” I came across in the car park of a local mall on my morning walk.

item.title: Touchdown - USA
item.description: So its now late evening in Raleigh, North Carolina, and I have checked into my hotel after some 26 hours of travel.

item.title: America - the business trip
item.description: Tonight, I find my self making final rushed preparations for a business trip to America (well lets be honest here… the fact that they are my “final preparations” does not also mean that they are not my first round of preparations either!).

item.title: Day Dreaming - Day 3
item.description: So day three of our stay on Day Dream Island has come, and now almost past.

item.title: 5 things I would take to a desert island
item.description: So my last post got me thinking… What are the 5 things I would take to a desert island.

item.title: Day Dreaming - Day 2
item.description: Another sun filled day in paradise… well on Day Dream Island at least.

item.title: Day Dreaming - Day 1
item.description: So we hit the ground running in our first day on Day Dream Island, and went straight into relaxation overdrive.

item.title: The Day Dream Begins
item.description: So the Day Dream begins…

item.title: Turkey - The Wrap Up
item.description: We still have a day and a half left in Istanbul. Other than our last minute shopping and revisiting the Bazaar’s we are winding down and getting ready to come home.

item.title: Princes Island Ferry
item.description: Today we find ourselves jumping on the tram in Sultanahmet and heading down to the ports to grab a ferry out to the Princes Island.

item.title: The Grand Bazaar
item.description: So after getting in pretty late last night from our two day tour down to Gallipoli and Troy, we had a pretty slow morning all tolled.

item.title: Mythical Troy
item.description: So after out day in Gallipoli, our tour takes us across the narrows of the Dardanelles to Canakkale which is in the Asian side of Turkey, an where we spend the night before heading of to nearby Troy (Troya) in the morning.

item.title: Gallipoli
item.description: Today we are on an overnight tour that will take us down to Gallipoli (Gelibolu) and then overnight in Canakkale (on the Asian side of Turkey), and the a tour through historic Troy before heading back to Istanbul later in the evening of the second day.

item.title: Istanbul Day 2 - Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Spice Bazaar, Taksim Square and Kebabs
item.description: So our second full day in beautiful Istanbul has been packed with sight seeing - all the usual touristy places: The Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, The Spice Bazaar, and Taksim Square (notably we are leaving the Grand Bazaar for a later day).

item.title: Istanbul awakes
item.description: So after our first day in Istanbul I can confess it has well and truly won me over. There is something about Istanbul… Something I can’t quite put my finger on… something that has defiantly drawn me in.

item.title: We're in Istanbul, not Constantinople...
item.description: Wow, long flight overnight again. Seems like forever ago that we were checking in to our flight in KL airport. Anyway the flight was reasonably uneventful again (which in the case of air travel is actually a positive attribute).

item.title: Two days in Kuala Lumpur
item.description:
Day 1
So we arrived in Kuala Lumpur bright and early after a reasonably uneventful overnight flight from Melbourne.

item.title: Top 10 visited, and bucket list destinations
item.description: So I have started to put some more thought into the content of my blog - trying to refocus back on why I originally started it - travel, stories and experiences.

item.title: Preparing the Turkey - The lead up to our Istanbul trip
item.description: So Laura and I will be heading off to Turkey in a few weeks. While Laura has been to Turkey twice previously, this will put a tick in the “done” column on my travel bucket list.

item.title: South Pacific Cruise Wrap Up
item.description: So we are back on dry land after 7 nights aboard the the Pacific Dawn - why are we still rocking?

item.title: South Pacific Cruise
item.description: By this time next week we will be cruising in the middle of the South Pacific - sun, sea breeze, and the obligatory beer/cocktail.

item.title: Long weekend camping @ Paradise Valley
item.description: ] Well the long weekend is over, and we survived the weather…

item.title: Home time
item.description: We made it back to Bangkok from Phuket, and are ready to board our flight back home to Australia!It’s hard to believe that after 4 months it’s finlay home time… It had to happen, and we are both ready for it.

item.title: Time out in Thailand
item.description: After a long flight (11 hours) from London, we touched down in Bangkok, collected our bags, and exited the airport to our awaiting hotel transfer.

item.title: Heathrow, Terminal 4, BA Lounge
item.description: Let me start by saying - This place is ace!

item.title: San Lupo
item.description: We arrived into Benevento by train from Naples, and were greeted warmly by Laura’s relations Sandra and Lorenzo Ciaglia. We then drove for about 30min up into the hills to our destination, the small town of San Lupo.

item.title: Napoli, Sorrento and beyond
item.description: After our adventures in Rome, our next stop was Napoli.

item.title: When in Rome...
item.description: We made it to Rome after a pleasant few days in the Cinque Terre. Almost immediately we noticed that it was a little warmer here in Rome, away from the cooler comfort of the coast that Cinque Terre offered.

item.title: The Cinque Terre
item.description: We arrived in Riomaggiore, the southern most town in the group of 5 towns that make up the ‘Cinque Terre’, and were immediately amazed by the bella vista that was in front of us.

item.title: Pisa - in and out
item.description: On our way from Certaldo to Cinque Terre we made a very brisk stop over in Pisa for the obligatory photos…

item.title: Under the Tuscan Sun
item.description: The transport strike has finished, and so has our forced day of relaxation in Bologna (yes… we did absolutely nothing, and loved it!) - we grabbed the early train out of town and headed for Certaldo in Tuscany.

item.title: Italian transport strike
item.description: Despite all efforts to plan and schedule the Italian leg of our trip, there is nothing we can do about a public transport strike.

item.title: The Bologna country side
item.description: ] We arrived in Bologna yesterday afternoon, after a short train trip from Venice (2 hours). We managed to navigate the local bus system with the help of a local and shortly after arrived at our B&B which is located in the country side hills overlooking farmland and the city - about 15 minutes drive out of town.

item.title: Viva Italia
item.description: ] We are finally on the last leg of our trip (in Europe anyway!) - we hit Italy three days ago (1st July), having caught a rather scenic train from Salzburg. The scenery was absolutely amazing - travelling by train through the Austrian and Italian Alps is highly recommended. There are a few rather long tunnels at times, but the scenery, especially prior to leaving Austria was unbelievable.

item.title: The Sound of Salzburg
item.description: We pick-up here were our last post left off. We have arrived in Salzburg – and its the night of the Euro Cup 2008 final, Germany -v- Spain. With Austria being the hosts, we were in for a big night (it had already been a long day… whats a few more hours).

item.title: Munich...Beer halls, beer halls, beer halls... Oh and tripod!
item.description: So we left Prague, and the Czech Republic behind us (and the train made it this time!) for the spoils of Munich (passing back through Dresden, to minimize our ticket cost, and maximize our use of the Eurail pass).

item.title: A touch of Prague
item.description: Having arrived in Prague and settled in (after out exciting train ride) we decided to take a tour of Prague city – old, and new.

item.title: Dresden to Prague by train - the experience
item.description: ] We laid awake this morning at about 4.50 am listening to the pouring rain, and claps of thunder didn’t put a positive spin on the day to come. After drifting back to sleep, we eventually go up and began to get ready for the day at about 6am - we had an early train to catch to Prague, at least the rain had stopped.

item.title: Dresden - The old and the new
item.description: We arrived into Dresden on the ICE train from Berlin and immediately fell in love with the city - despite it being a Sunday, and (almost) everything being shut.

item.title: Berlin, Berlin
item.description: Today is our last day in Berlin – we are currently in the train station having breakfast and a coffee waiting for our train to Dresden.

item.title: Guten tag! Willkommen in Deuchland
item.description: So we are in Germany now – having arrived from Tampere, Finland into Bremen the other day. We have been in Bremen for the last few days, staying with friends (Suzanne & Richard) in their lovely apartment which is just a short ride from the heart of Bremen.

item.title: Finland here we come - for a night!
item.description: ] We jetted out of Athens this afternoon with our friends FinAir. The flight started out fine - a nice new plane and decent food - then the announcement came over the loud speaker “… the movie that will be shown today is The Bucket List” (great! we’ve only seen it 3 times already), “and it will be shown without audio, and with Finnish subtitles.”

item.title: Our last day in Greece
item.description: ] Today is our last full day in Greece, as we fly out tomorrow at lunch time - meaning an early start to make sure we get to the airport on time.

item.title: A slow boat on the Aegean
item.description: Today we headed out early to catch a cruise around three of the Greek islands closest to Athens.

item.title: A slow day in Athens
item.description: We got into Athens yesterday afternoon - great weather, we managed to escape the bad weather that has been forecast for the UK!

item.title: London and Liverpool
item.description: London - Our initial taste

item.title: All aboard the Paddy Wagon
item.description: Sorry it’s been a while since out last update, but it can be hectic on the road - never knowing when and where you will get a chance to have 5 minutes free to post a message or two (and I have to say touring in Ireland, with its many pubs does create a pretty big distraction :) ).

item.title: London calling
item.description: We have now left the Spanish speaking countries behind us after about 7 weeks of traveling. We find it hard to stop saying ‘Gracias’ to people - but I’m sure we will get over it.

item.title: Madrid to Barcelona
item.description: So after a reasonably restful sleep overnight we got into exploring Madrid early – eager to use the remainder of the time available on our 24hr Madrid Vision card (we had until about 2pm) – first on the list was a coffee at one of the many local cafe’s, then onto the Royal Palace for a tour.

item.title: Madrid - Spain
item.description: We have now left South America behind us, and moved onto the European leg of our trip.

item.title: On to Argentina
item.description: We have left Peru behind after a month of travel through the country – along the way making some great friendships. So onto Argentina it is.

item.title: Peru in review
item.description: Our time in Peru has come to an end - we are moving on and leaving behind some awesome memories and great new friends.

item.title: Welcome to the Jungle
item.description: From the comfort of Cuzco, we headed our on an AreoCondor flight to Puerto Maldonado in the Amazon Jungle.

item.title: Machu Picchu
item.description: We got off to a very early start this morning - 4.30am, breakfast at 5, and on the bus up to Machu Picchu at 5.30.

item.title: On the road to Machu Picchu
item.description: ] So we left Cuzco yesterday afternoon headed for Ollantaytambo, a small rural town which is part of Cuzco province, and a couple of hours out of Cuzco city.

item.title: Cuzco here we come
item.description: So after another long bus ride across the Andean country side we arrived in Cuzco yesterday afternoon - and what a relief this was. The 7 hour bus ride across Peruvian highways that at times were as smooth as a bad gravel road was wearing thin - plus our butts were sore from sitting for so long ;).

item.title: Lake Titicaca home stay
item.description: So we are back in Puno now (which is located on the shores of lake Titicaca) after leaving yesterday morning for our home-stay. We are both felling 100% on what we have been and hopefully the worst is behind us. We still need to be a little careful with our stomachs as they are still a little tender, but generally much better than they have been over the past 3-4 days.

item.title: Colca Canyon and Home Stay
item.description: From Arequipa we headed to the Colca Canyon - passing through altitudes of almost 5,000m on the way.

item.title: We made it to Arequipa
item.description: ] So we caught the overnight bus from Nazca last night. We were not expecting too much, but we were pretty surprised when we boarded the bus to find it was equipped with recliner seats - i’m not just talking about being able to recline the back of the seat, but a leg rest as well. It was pretty well equipped - not that is really any exchange for a real bed and pillow. While we did sleep, I was pretty restless but probably the best you could expect on a bus.

item.title: Peru here we come
item.description: It’s been a few days since we have had a chance to grab a seat in front of a computer (probably a good thing), so I will try to fill you all in on what we have been up to in the last few days.

item.title: Peruvian Highlights Tour Begins
item.description: We meet up with our tour group last night in Miraflores (just out of Lima) in the hotel we were staying in for the night.

item.title: Rum Night (Is there a theme forming?)
item.description: Today we jumped onto a tour bus (Mira Tours) that took us for a 3 hour tour through Lima city and to the San Fransisco church and catacombs. This was a pretty cool tour. We got to see or first real glimpses of Lima city and the catacombs at the San Francisco church were pretty cool.

item.title: Pisco night
item.description: After the first good sleep we have had in the last week or so - I think the jet lag has finally left us - we got out and explored the local area a bit.

item.title: Touchdown in Lima
item.description: So we flew out of Santiago this morning (bright and early) into Lima, Peru.

item.title: Our last day in Santiago
item.description: So today is our last day in Santiago. We started out by heading to the post office to send off a few post cards to family back home. Right next to the post office in the Plaza de Armas is a huge old church where we went to mass.

item.title: In and around Santiago
item.description: So we have settled our selves in and found our feet here in Santiago. We have managed to explore most of what the city has to offer (we think).

item.title: Santiago pictures
Hola! The trip begins.
item.description: Hi all,

item.title: The Modrich Blog - Travel, Stories, Experiences...
item.description: Welcome to The Modrich Blog.
